summary: An email chain from August 30, 2019, discussing a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein. A U.S. Attorney's Office contact forwards a request from an AUSA in Boston about a former model who was taken to Epstein's townhouse and is being contacted by David Boies' law firm. The recipient offers to speak with the victim.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Mentioned as the attorney whose firm is contacting a potential Epstein victim, causing her confusion.

events.title: Model taken to Epstein's townhouse
events.description: A former model was taken to Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse one night approximately 20 years prior to 2019; the exact events are unclear.

events.title: Email referral of potential victim
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney in Boston contacts a colleague in the Southern District of New York to refer a potential Epstein victim for assistance and guidance.

keyFacts: A potential victim, described as a model in NYC about 20 years ago, was taken to Jeffrey Epstein's townhouse.
The victim had spoken to attorney David Boies, and his firm was actively calling her, causing her distress and confusion.
An AUSA in Boston reached out to colleagues in the Southern District of New York (USANYS) to connect the victim with the appropriate office handling the Epstein case.
The email correspondence demonstrates ongoing efforts in 2019 to identify and assist victims related to the Epstein investigation.
